snippet: On a recent mission, a unit of the Afghan National Army gave some clues to how prepared it was to fight the Taliban after American forces are gone.
abstract: Sprawling and drawn-out battle between Afghan forces and Taliban stronghold in Damdara, Afghanistan, highlights difficulties Afghan National Army may face in effectively fighting its enemies after Americans leave; fighting reveals that unit is still struggling to overcome logistical and political challenges, despite noted combat successes.
lead_paragraph: On a recent mission, a unit of the Afghan National Army gave some clues to how prepared it was to fight the Taliban after American forces are gone.

headline.seo: Afghan Army Learning to Fight on Its Own
headline.main: With Swagger, Afghan Army Takes the Lead
headline.print_headline: With Swagger, Afghan Army Takes the Lead

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
